alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cabell; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Mason; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Mason, east central Cabell, northwestern Kanawha, Putnam, eastern Lincoln, south central Jackson and northwestern Boone Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hurricane to near Julian. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Ripley, Winfield, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Eleanor, Marmet, Belle, Buffalo, Poca, Institute, Tornado, Cross Lanes, Alum Creek and Julian. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 118, and between mile markers 133 and 136. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 31 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 89 and 94. Route 119 between mile markers 53 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Cabell; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Mason; Putnam
